public class RandomGenerator
extends java.lang.Object

Utility to generate arrays of random variables TODO I think I may need to revisit whether I reuse the objects added to the hashtable; I don't think we should be doing this.

Author:
Joseph Lizier

generateBivariateNormalData

public double[][] generateBivariateNormalData(int length,
                                              double mean1,
                                              double std1,
                                              double mean2,
                                              double std2,
                                              double covariance)

Generate bivariate Gaussian series with the given covariance. See http://mathworld.wolfram.com/BivariateNormalDistribution.html

If we have two normal distributions x1 and x2, we can define

  • y1 = mean1 + sigma11*x1 + sigma12*x2
  • y2 = mean2 + sigma21*x1 + sigma22*x2
which are Gaussian distributed with:
  • means (mean1,mean2),
  • variances (sigma11^2+sigma12^2, sigma21^2+sigma22^2), and
  • covariance sigma11*sigma21 + sigma12*sigma22
So to generate a bivariate series with a desired covariance, means and stds, we set sigma12=0, giving sigma11 = std1, solve for sigma21 from the covariance, and solve for sigma22 from the std2.

Parameters:
length -
mean1 -
std1 -
mean2 -
std2 -
covariance -
Returns:
a time series with two variables: first index is time step, second index is variable number

generateCovariantGaussians

public double[][] generateCovariantGaussians(int length,
                                             int dimensions,
                                             double[] means,
                                             double[][] componentDependencies)
Generate a set of covariant gaussians, with the given means and covariances.

Parameters:
length - Number of time steps (samples) generated
dimensions - Number of gaussians
means - Means of the generated gaussians
componentDependencies - Underlying depencence matrix A between the generated gaussians. Covariance C = A * A^T
Returns:
